td.content: s:pt presents with mild swollen legs, moderate increase in abdominal girth, moderate swollen feet and Heart for 4 weeks. he has a history of Chronic Congestive Heart Failure for past 4 years. pt is a 65 yo white male. he states he has never smoked a cigarette in his life he drinks alcohol heavily for the past 3 years o:Height 75 in, Weight 171 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, 2D echocardiogram panel LEFT and RIGHT Ventricular Enlargement (4 chamber dilatation) w/ decreased LEFT systolic ventricular function, Heart = loud p2, RV S3, Abdomen = mild tender hepatomegaly, hepatojugular reflex (+), Chest = B/L crackles are present the lower lobes, decrease breath sounds, Neck = JVD present (17 cm), Extremities = 4 + pitting lowering edema a:Chronic Congestive Heart Failure p:administered valsartan - 160 mg 2 x day, performed 2D echocardiogram panel, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

s:patient presents w/ c/o 9 days h/o Body Aches. he is a 65 YO male. he denies ever using cigarettes pt has a history of excessive levels of alcohol consumption o:Height 74 in, Weight 165 lbs, Temperature 98 F, Pulse 69, SystolicBP 103, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 14 a:Joint Pain p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed acetaminophen - 650 mg up to 4x day, and ordered air contrast arthrography of affected joint(s).
